case_title: Muhammad Ameen vs Deputy Commissioner Panjgur

legal_basis.constitution_article: Article 199 of the Constitution of Islamic Republic of Pakistan, 1973

precedents.case: Dr. Sher Afgan Khan Niazi v. Ali S. Habib and others
N.W.F.P. Public Service Commission and others v. Muhammad Arif and others
M.H. Abidi v. Scare Life Insurance Corporation
Muhammad Nazim v. Rehana Parveen Begum

key_points.petitioner_claim: Compensation for land affected by road cutting.
key_points.respondent_argument: Property belongs to the Government of Balochistan; petitioner lacks title documents.
key_points.court_observation: Petitioner failed to provide clear title documents; disputed property title requires adjudication in Civil Court.
key_points.jurisdiction_limitation: Constitutional jurisdiction under Article 199 cannot address disputed property titles.

recommendation: Petitioner advised to approach relevant authority or Civil Court for resolution.
